New idea for engineering estimations:

1. Choose number of weeks you think it will take
2. Use that as a temperature in Celsius
3. Convert to Farenheit
4. This is your actual number of weeks

Example: 
3 weeks > 3 C > 37.4 F > 37.4 weeks

Explainer on #Spectre & #Meltdown:

When a processor reaches a conditional branch in code (e.g. an 'if' clause), it tries to predict which branch will be taken before it actually knows the result. It executes that branch ahead of time - a feature called "speculative execution".

1062072822573527040.text: Now the delay for the 20th element will only be 0.22s as opposed to 1.0s!! Many eyeballs will thank you for making the entire transition happen in roughly <300ms

1062072359992078336.text: Something like this… (You may actually want to slightly increase your coefficient since the delays will be much tighter now)pic.twitter.com/DKAB3lCh5v

1062071538126671872.text: Consider a basic decay! A simple root function will do wonders here. Now the delays will start off feeling similar to the linear function but then will bunch up nicely instead of growing wildly. Imagine an anchor pulling chains off the deck of a boat w/ increasing speed! pic.twitter.com/oalJqOHng4

1062070150042697728.text: Consider adding acceleration to your delays so that they get increasingly shorter! If you have a list of 20 things all fading and moving in with 0.05s delays that's still means last item won't start animating-in for a full second! That's heavy.pic.twitter.com/1cSOnfouSM

1055379847965483008.text: Google already uses the “shake to undo” motion for app feedback. I still trigger this all the time when walking through a new city with maps open and hate it but mostly because it’s a blocking modal and a poorly defined gesture of “shaking”.

1055379400185790464.text: And yes triggering this accidentally isn’t great. I imagine the first time you do it you’d be asked if you wanted to turn the feature on. Once you know what to expect and give clear haptic/visual feedback it’s hard to miss doing it accidentally and easy to correct for if you do.

1055378570753859589.text: I’d love to see more apps add gestural interactions but an even easier thing to add is motion interactions! I so badly wish I could give Google Translate a hard flick of the wrist to the left or right to switch translation direction.
